1. Appeal to Authority - The tweet from Eric Zemmour stating "Je veux une France puissante dans l’innovation technologique. Merci @FRdigitale!" is an appeal to authority fallacy because it relies on the authority of FRdigitale to support his argument for a technologically powerful France.
Example: "Eric Zemmour says we need to focus on technological innovation in France because FRdigitale supports this idea."

2. False Dichotomy - The tweet from Jean-Luc Melenchon stating "Je n'ai jamais soutenu monsieur Vladimir Poutine. Jamais. Je vous mets au défi de le prouver." could be seen as a false dichotomy implying that the only two options are supporting Poutine or not supporting him.
Example: "If you don't support Poutine, you must support Melenchon, there is no other option."

3. Ad Hominem - The tweet directed at Eric Zemmour saying "On déchire vôtre affiche, c'est scandaleux...école des lilas" is an ad hominem attack directed at his poster, rather than addressing his political stance.
Example: "People who rip down Zemmour's posters are just trying to cause trouble, they don't have any valid arguments against him."
